clinical_question: Should patients with RA on two or more DMARDs who are at target for six months and longer withdraw DMARDs or continue DMARDs?
population: Patients with RA on two or more DMARDs at target for six months and longer
intervention: Withdraw one DMARD (or more than one DMARD as long as the patient remains on at least one DMARD)
outcome: Disease activity (follow up: 3 months; assessed with: DAS28-ESR (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID -1.17)

Risk of bias.rationales: Concern about the lack of blinding of participants and providers

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with RA on two or more DMARDs who are at target for six months and longer withdraw DMARDs or continue DMARDs?
population: Patients with RA on two or more DMARDs at target for six months and longer
intervention: Withdraw one DMARD (or more than one DMARD as long as the patient remains on at least one DMARD)
outcome: Flare (follow up: range 11 months to 18 months)

Risk of bias.rationales: All included studies are at risk of bias

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio

clinical_question: Should patients with RA on two or more DMARDs who are at target for six months and longer withdraw DMARDs or continue DMARDs?
population: Patients with RA on two or more DMARDs at target for six months and longer
intervention: Withdraw one DMARD (or more than one DMARD as long as the patient remains on at least one DMARD)
outcome: Disability (follow up: 3 months; assessed with: HAQ-DI (Lower values – > benefit) (MCID -0.22)

Risk of bias.rationales: Concern about the lack of blinding of participants and providers

Imprecision.rationales: CI includes both values suggesting harms and values suggesting no effect

Effect.Abbreviations: CI: Confidence interval; RR: Risk ratio; MD: Mean difference; HR: Hazard Ratio
